chemoreception.notes: Deep-sea hydrothermal vent limpets likely rely heavily on chemoreception to locate vents and suitable substrates. Inferred due to their habitat.

mechanoreception.notes: Limpets generally use mechanoreceptors to sense their environment and maintain attachment to surfaces. Likely important for navigation and stability in vent environments.

vision.notes: The presence or absence of functional vision in Neomphalidae is unknown. Given the deep-sea hydrothermal vent environment, it may be reduced or absent.
